titles.title: Medicare and Medicaid Nursing Services Quality Improvement Demonstration Act of 2000

To establish a demonstration project to waive certain nurse training requirements for specially trained individuals who perform certain specific nursing-related tasks in Medicare and Medicaid nursing facilities.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

bill.summary: 9/25/2000--Introduced. Medicare and Medicaid Nursing Services Quality Improvement Demonstration Act of 2000 - Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a five-year demonstration project under which nurse aide training requirements are waived in up to five eligible States in the case of specially trained individuals with respect to specific nursing tasks.
